Data Science Process

About

Statistics 386 is a class taught in the Statistics Department at Brigham Young University. In this class, we cover the data science process including collecting and wrangling data, version control, exploratory data analysis, visualization, ethics and bias. The class this semester is taught by Shannon Tass.


Check out our class member blogs and our GitHub organization
